To further interrogate the accessible chromatin landscape during somite development, we used HINT-ATAC
42 to discover differential TF footprints in regions of open chromatin identified in PSM, ES, MS or DS. Initially we focussed on the CDX2 TF, which is a readout for posterior WNT signalling and has been implicated in defining neuromesodermal progenitors (NMP)
43 . CDX2 is essential for axial elongation
22 and is highly expressed in the PSM (Fig. 3a). Consistent with high levels of WNT signalling activity in the PSM, HINT-ATAC identified a greater number of CDX2 footprints in open chromatin in this region when compared to ES, MS and DS (Fig. 3b–d). Similarly, LEF1, a transcriptional effector for canonical WNT signalling, is highly expressed in the PSM (Fig. 3e). LEF1 is also expressed in somites, where it becomes restricted to the myotome
44, 45 . We identified a greater number of LEF1 footprints in the PSM when compared to any of the somite samples, consistent with the more restricted expression of LEF1 in the latter (Fig. 3f–h).
